Class ClientConnection

java.lang.Object
  nano.remexp.client.net.ClientConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventSocketListener
public class ClientConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventSocketListener

This is the interface between the client and the socket.

Version:
1.1 23.08.2012
Author:
Dominic Bosch

Constructor Summary
ClientConnection(ClientApplet app)
          The constructor needs to know the applet to handle events coming through the socket.

ClientConnection

public ClientConnection(ClientApplet app)
The constructor needs to know the applet to handle events coming through the socket.

isConnected

Informs about the connectivity to the client.

Returns:
true if connected, else false

Releases the client socket.

Sends a message over the socket.

Parameters:

performSocketEvent

public void performSocketEvent(EventSocket sock,
                               java.lang.String msg)
If an event is passed through the socket it will be displayed to the client or if it is a stage event, the appropriate action is being handled by the applet.

Specified by:
performSocketEvent in interface EventSocketListener
Parameters:
sock - The socket on which the event has been detected.
msg - The message that has been sent.

removeEventSocket

public void removeEventSocket(EventSocket sock)
Shuts down the socket to the server and sets it null.

Specified by:
removeEventSocket in interface EventSocketListener
Parameters:
sock - The socket to be removed.

shutDown

public void shutDown()
Shutting down the client socket

login

public void login(EventSocket sock,
                  java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String pass)
not used for client

Specified by:
login in interface EventSocketListener
Parameters:
sock - The socket that tries to gain privileges.
username - The username used to gain privileges.
pass - The password passed as a MD-5 hash in case of a non-LiLa login, empty if LiLa login shall be attempted.
